text: (gentle music)
- In 1979, Toyota launched our mainframe.
To put that in perspective,
that same year we launched a Supra.
Both at the time were amazing innovations,

but ultimately the Supra held
up, mainframe, not so much.
(upbeat music)
The work that we did with AWS
is gonna be game changing for Toyota.
Toyota has invested the last 45 years
in a mainframe system that is responsible
for our entire supply chain, and today,

90% of that supply chain
still runs on the mainframe.

If the mainframe goes
down, we cannot sell cars.
When we have to make a change,

having to reverse engineer
code is very time consuming.
In the past when we tried
to migrate away from the mainframe,

we were always told years
and billions of dollars.
We reached out to AWS, and we asked them,
"Would you be open to helping us
migrate from our mainframe?
What would it take for us to figure out

how we can get generative
AI to be able to do
that reverse engineering for us?"
AWS said, "We're all in."
Using Amazon Q, making it even better

by supporting COBOL, validated
by Toyota COBOL engineers,
we were able to scan hundreds of modules

and output quality
documentation in a single day.

That would normally have
taken us months to do.

Toyota would be able to get off
the mainframe in record time

and create something
that was truly unique.

It's just something
we're totally proud of.
